title: How to Make Bajang

steps.headline: Wash the bamboo leaves and let them soak in water overnight.
Soak the sticky rice in water for 4-5 hours.
Slice the pork and let it marinate in soy sauce until tender.
Soak the shiitake mushrooms in water until soft, then chop them.
Boil the ginko leaves in syrup to give them a sweeter flavour.
Bring the bamboo leaves to a boil in water after they've soaked overnight, then wipe them clean and allow them to dry.
Fry the sticky rice, shrimp, peanuts, and salted turnips together, and season with salt, sugar, and soy sauce.
Fry the pork, egg yolks, shiitake mushrooms, water chestnuts, and ginko leaves together in a separate pan, then season with soy sauce.
Take two bamboo leaves and lay them on top of one another, overlapping them slightly.
Shape the bamboo leaves into a tight cone.
Place one large scoop of the sticky rice mixture into the bottom of the cone, and use a spoon to create a bowl shape in the rice.
Put one large scoop of the pork mixture on top of the rice, filling the bowl shape.
Put one large scoop of the sticky rice mixture over top of the pork filling.
Fold the excess bamboo leaves over top of the rice, then wrap them around the cone to form a pyramid.
steps.description: Wrap it tightly, then cut off any excess leaf with scissors.

steps.headline: Steam the bajang pyramids for 1 hour.

text: Preparation Wash the bamboo leaves and let them soak in water overnight.  Soak the sticky rice in water for 4-5 hours.  Slice the pork and let it marinate in soy sauce until tender.  Soak the shiitake mushrooms in water until soft, then chop them.  Boil the ginko leaves in syrup to give them a sweeter flavour.  Bring the bamboo leaves to a boil in water after they've soaked overnight, then wipe them clean and allow them to dry.  Cooking Fry the sticky rice, shrimp, peanuts, and salted turnips together, and season with salt, sugar, and soy sauce. Set aside. Fry the pork, egg yolks, shiitake mushrooms, water chestnuts, and ginko leaves together in a separate pan, then season with soy sauce.  Wrapping Take two bamboo leaves and lay them on top of one another, overlapping them slightly.  Shape the bamboo leaves into a tight cone.  Place one large scoop of the sticky rice mixture into the bottom of the cone, and use a spoon to create a bowl shape in the rice.  Put one large scoop of the pork mixture on top of the rice, filling the bowl shape.  Put one large scoop of the sticky rice mixture over top of the pork filling.  Fold the excess bamboo leaves over top of the rice, then wrap them around the cone to form a pyramid. Wrap it tightly, then cut off any excess leaf with scissors. Steam the bajang pyramids for 1 hour.
